txt.en: Warg-riders make their way through the mountain-crags and slip into and out of the shadows of Moria with ease. At the Grand Stair, a leader and his aged mount have come to bend knee to Igash the Fanatic and Mazog.

'One by one, the Orcs travelled up the hallways towards the entrance to the Grand Stair. At their head, riding a Warg scarred by many battles, rode a banner-bearing goblin. I heard his name echoed from the forces as they cheered, seeing the entrance to their new home.

'Their tribute rested on litters dragged by other Warg-riders. Glothrok the Vile, a scourge of the Misty Mountains and leader of the Warg-riders, entered at their head. 

'Never have I seen such a terrifying beast ridden by so confident a goblin. They must be destroyed, and to accomplish this, you must enter the Grand Stair, north-east of the Orc-watch.'

Glothrok the Vile is within the Grand Stair, north-east of the Orc-watch.\n\nThithrand seemed unnerved at the sight of a powerful goblin riding an even more powerful-looking Warg. The pair entered the Grand Stair at the head of the Warg-riders and have not been seen since.

'You have done well to defeat this foe. I am certain that this goblin was one of the strongest I have ever seen.\n\n'To think that all these foes were preparing to assault Lothl√≥rien. Your efforts will prove to be of great worth, I think, [placeholder].'
Thithrand is at the Orc-watch, south-west of the Grand Stair.\n\nYou should return to Thithrand with news of your victory.
'Enter the Grand Stair to the north-east of the Orc-watch and find the goblin Warg-rider Glothrol the Vile. Slay him and the beast he rides before returning to me.'
Talk to Thithrand at the Orc-watch
